title: Backend: Design Jint Wrapper Service and Sandbox Options
description: Analyze Jint library capabilities and design a service (`ITransformationService`) that encapsulates the engine. Define a configuration class (`JintSandboxOptions`) to hold constraint values for timeout, memory, statements, and CLR access.
sprint_goal: Establish the secure, auditable backend foundation for the transformation engine and deliver the basic UI for creating scripts.
acceptance_criteria: Interface contract for `ITransformationService` is defined. A POCO class for sandbox options is created. The design is documented in a brief technical note.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Design document approved; Interfaces defined.
testing_requirements: Design review.
business_value: Protects the core application from instability and security threats posed by user-defined code.

title: Backend: Implement Jint Engine with Configurable Security Constraints
description: Implement a factory or service that instantiates a Jint `Engine` with options for `MaxStatements`, `MemoryLimit`, `TimeoutInterval`, and `AllowClr(false)`. These options must be loaded from `appsettings.json` via the Options pattern.
sprint_goal: Establish the secure, auditable backend foundation for the transformation engine and deliver the basic UI for creating scripts.
acceptance_criteria: The Jint Engine is instantiated with options reflecting the values in `appsettings.json`. The `AllowClr` option is explicitly set to `false` and is not configurable. The service can be injected via DI.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed with security focus; Unit tests passing; Configuration options documented.
testing_requirements: Unit tests verifying options are applied.
business_value: Protects the core application from instability and security threats posed by user-defined code.

title: Backend: Implement Exception Handling for Constraint Violations
description: Wrap Jint execution calls in try-catch blocks to specifically handle `StatementsCountOverflowException`, `MemoryLimitExceededException`, and `OperationCanceledException` (for timeout). These exceptions should be re-thrown as custom, domain-specific exceptions.
sprint_goal: Establish the secure, auditable backend foundation for the transformation engine and deliver the basic UI for creating scripts.
acceptance_criteria: A Jint `MemoryLimitExceededException` is caught and re-thrown as `SandboxMemoryException`. A Jint `StatementsCountOverflowException` is caught and re-thrown as `SandboxStatementException`. An `OperationCanceledException` is caught and re-thrown as `SandboxTimeoutException`.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests for each exception type are passing.
testing_requirements: Unit tests simulating Jint exceptions.
business_value: Provides clear, structured error information for sandbox violations.

title: QA: Create Malicious Unit Tests for Sandbox Constraints
description: Develop a suite of unit tests that intentionally try to violate each configured sandbox constraint. These tests will serve as a security regression suite.
sprint_goal: Establish the secure, auditable backend foundation for the transformation engine and deliver the basic UI for creating scripts.
acceptance_criteria: A test that runs an infinite loop correctly throws `SandboxTimeoutException`. A test that allocates a large array correctly throws `SandboxMemoryException`. A test that runs a long loop correctly throws `SandboxStatementException`. A test that attempts to access `System.IO.File` throws a `Jint.Runtime.JavaScriptException` containing a `SecurityException`.
definition_of_done: All tests are passing in the CI pipeline; Test cases reviewed for security coverage.
testing_requirements: Security-focused regression testing.
deployment_notes: These tests are critical for release gating.
business_value: Validates the primary security controls of the transformation engine.

title: Backend: Design Audit Log Entity and Storage
description: Design the entity for audit logs, including fields for timestamp, user ID, source IP, action type, entity type, entity ID, and change details (e.g., a JSON blob). Decide on the storage mechanism (e.g., a separate `AuditLogs` table in SQLite).
sprint_goal: Establish the secure, auditable backend foundation for the transformation engine and deliver the basic UI for creating scripts.
acceptance_criteria: The `AuditLog` entity is defined in C#. The storage strategy is chosen and documented. An EF Core migration (if applicable) is generated.
definition_of_done: Design review with compliance expert completed; EF Core migration created and tested.
testing_requirements: Design review against SOC 2 / ISO 27001 objectives.
business_value: Provides the foundational data structure for a compliant audit trail.

title: Backend: Implement Audit Logging Service
description: Create an `IAuditLogger` service and its implementation that writes `AuditLog` records to the chosen persistent storage. The service should be injectable and handle the formatting of audit events.
sprint_goal: Establish the secure, auditable backend foundation for the transformation engine and deliver the basic UI for creating scripts.
acceptance_criteria: The service can successfully write an audit log entry to the database. The service is registered for dependency injection. The logging operation is asynchronous.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Service registered in DI container.
testing_requirements: Unit tests to verify service can write to an in-memory database.
business_value: Provides a reusable service for creating audit log entries throughout the application.

title: Backend: Design Script and Version Entities
description: Design the EF Core entities for `TransformationScript` (parent) and `TransformationScriptVersion` (child). The parent will track the name and active version, while the child will hold the script content and metadata.
sprint_goal: Establish the secure, auditable backend foundation for the transformation engine and deliver the basic UI for creating scripts.
acceptance_criteria: Entity classes are defined with properties and relationships. A one-to-many relationship is established between Script and Version. An EF Core migration is successfully generated from the models.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; EF Core migration generated and tested.
testing_requirements: Successful migration application on a test database.
business_value: Provides the data structure for storing and versioning transformation scripts.

title: Backend: Implement POST API for Script Creation
description: Create the `POST /api/v1/transformations` endpoint. The service logic must create both a `TransformationScript` and its initial `TransformationScriptVersion` (v1) within a single transaction.
sprint_goal: Establish the secure, auditable backend foundation for the transformation engine and deliver the basic UI for creating scripts.
acceptance_criteria: A POST request with a valid name and content returns 201 Created. The database contains one `TransformationScript` and one `TransformationScriptVersion` record after the call. The parent script's `activeVersionId` points to the new version. The operation is atomic; if part of it fails, no records are created.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests passing; API documented in OpenAPI spec.
testing_requirements: Integration tests covering success and transactional failure.
business_value: Provides the API for creating new transformation scripts.

title: Backend: Secure Transformation API with RBAC
description: Apply the `[Authorize(Roles = "Administrator")]` attribute to the `TransformationsController` class or to individual CUD actions within it to restrict access.
sprint_goal: Establish the secure, auditable backend foundation for the transformation engine and deliver the basic UI for creating scripts.
acceptance_criteria: The attribute is correctly applied to all CUD endpoints. Read endpoints (GET) may remain accessible to other roles if required by future stories, but CUD must be admin-only.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests for RBAC are passing.
testing_requirements: Integration tests attempting to access endpoints with non-admin tokens.
business_value: Enforces the principle of least privilege for script management.

title: Backend: Integrate Auditing into Transformation Service
description: Modify the `TransformationService` to call the `IAuditLogger` after successfully completing a Create, Update, or Delete operation. The audit call must be part of the same transaction as the data modification.
sprint_goal: Establish the secure, auditable backend foundation for the transformation engine and deliver the basic UI for creating scripts.
acceptance_criteria: Creating a script logs a 'ScriptCreated' event. Updating a script logs a 'ScriptUpdated' event with before/after details if possible. Deleting a script logs a 'ScriptDeleted' event. If the database operation fails, no audit log is created.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests passing.
testing_requirements: Integration tests to verify audit log creation for each CUD operation.
business_value: Provides a clear, unalterable record of all changes to business logic.

title: Frontend: Research and PoC for Monaco Editor in Vite/React
description: Conduct a time-boxed spike (proof-of-concept) to integrate the Monaco Editor into the Vite-based React project. Resolve build-time issues with web workers and asset loading. This is a direct mitigation for RISK-004.
sprint_goal: Develop the core interactive editor experience, including real-time validation and preview with timeout, and implement script encryption.
acceptance_criteria: A basic Monaco Editor instance renders correctly in a development build. The PoC is buildable for production using Vite without errors. A summary of findings and the recommended integration approach is documented.
definition_of_done: PoC branch is merged or findings are documented; The team agrees on the integration path.
testing_requirements: Manual PoC validation.
deployment_notes: This task is critical to unblock the entire UI track for transformations.
business_value: De-risks a major technical challenge for the user interface.

title: Frontend: Implement Monaco Editor Wrapper Component with Validation
description: Create a reusable React component that wraps the Monaco Editor. This component will be configured for the JavaScript language, enable built-in syntax validation, and expose props for setting content and an `onValidationChange` callback.
sprint_goal: Develop the core interactive editor experience, including real-time validation and preview with timeout, and implement script encryption.
acceptance_criteria: The component renders the editor with JavaScript syntax highlighting. The editor shows red squiggles for syntax errors. The component's `onValidationChange` callback fires with an array of errors when syntax is invalid, and with an empty array when valid.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component is documented with Storybook; Unit tests passing.
testing_requirements: Unit tests for component props and callbacks.
business_value: Provides a reusable, high-quality code editor for all script management features.

title: Frontend: Develop 'Create Script' Page and Form
description: Build the React page for creating a new transformation script. This includes a form with an input for the name and integration of the `ScriptEditor` component for the content.
sprint_goal: Develop the core interactive editor experience, including real-time validation and preview with timeout, and implement script encryption.
acceptance_criteria: The page renders a form with 'Name' and editor fields. The 'Save' button calls the `POST` API with the form data. On success, it redirects to the script list and shows a success notification. API errors (e.g., duplicate name) are displayed to the user.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E tests passing; Form is responsive and accessible.
testing_requirements: E2E tests for form submission and error handling.
business_value: Provides the user interface for creating new transformation scripts.

title: Backend: Implement Preview API Endpoint
description: Create the `POST /api/v1/transformations/preview` endpoint that accepts a script content string and a sample data JSON string. It should execute the script using the Jint service and return the transformed data or a structured error.
sprint_goal: Develop the core interactive editor experience, including real-time validation and preview with timeout, and implement script encryption.
acceptance_criteria: The endpoint returns 200 OK with transformed JSON for a valid request. The endpoint returns 400 Bad Request if the sample data is not valid JSON. The endpoint returns 400 Bad Request if the script has a runtime error, with details in the body.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests passing; API documented in OpenAPI spec.
testing_requirements: Integration tests for success, invalid JSON, and script runtime error scenarios.
business_value: Enables the interactive preview feature, a critical part of the script development workflow.

title: Frontend: Develop Preview Interaction Logic
description: Wire up the 'Preview' button. Implement a Zustand store to manage the state of the preview (script content, sample data, output, loading, error). On click, call the preview API and update the store with the result.
sprint_goal: Develop the core interactive editor experience, including real-time validation and preview with timeout, and implement script encryption.
acceptance_criteria: Clicking 'Preview' sends a request to the backend with current editor and input data. A loading spinner is displayed while the request is in flight. The output pane is updated with formatted JSON on success. The output pane is updated with a formatted error message on failure.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests for Zustand store passing; E2E tests for the preview workflow passing.
testing_requirements: E2E tests covering success, loading, and error states.
business_value: Provides the interactive feedback loop for script development.

title: Backend: Implement Server-Side Timeout on Preview API
description: Modify the `POST /api/v1/transformations/preview` endpoint to enforce a 15-second timeout. Use a `CancellationTokenSource` and pass its token down to the Jint execution service.
sprint_goal: Develop the core interactive editor experience, including real-time validation and preview with timeout, and implement script encryption.
acceptance_criteria: A request with a script that runs >15s is terminated. The API returns an HTTP 408 Request Timeout status code. The `OperationCanceledException` is caught and handled correctly.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration test for timeout passing.
testing_requirements: Integration test with a script containing an infinite loop.
business_value: Protects server resources and improves UI responsiveness.

title: Backend: Configure .NET Data Protection APIs (DPAPI)
description: Set up the DPAPI service in `Program.cs`, configuring key storage location and lifetime. For production, this will involve setting up keys to be persisted to the file system with appropriate permissions.
sprint_goal: Develop the core interactive editor experience, including real-time validation and preview with timeout, and implement script encryption.
acceptance_criteria: The `AddDataProtection()` service is configured. Key persistence is configured for the production environment. The configuration is documented for DevOps.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; DevOps documentation created.
testing_requirements: Code review.
deployment_notes: Requires specific file system permissions for the service account in production.
business_value: Establishes the foundation for encrypting all sensitive data at rest.

title: Backend: Implement EF Core Encrypted ValueConverter
description: Create a custom `ValueConverter<string, string>` for EF Core that injects `IDataProtectionProvider` and uses it to encrypt data on write and decrypt on read.
sprint_goal: Develop the core interactive editor experience, including real-time validation and preview with timeout, and implement script encryption.
acceptance_criteria: The converter correctly encrypts a given plaintext string. The converter correctly decrypts a given ciphertext string back to the original plaintext. The converter handles null values gracefully.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests covering encryption/decryption are passing.
testing_requirements: Unit tests.
business_value: Provides a reusable mechanism for transparently encrypting data in the database.

title: Backend: Implement PUT API for Script Updates
description: Create the `PUT /api/v1/transformations/{id}` endpoint. The service logic must create a new `TransformationScriptVersion` with the updated content and then update the parent `TransformationScript` to point to this new version as the active one. This must be a single transaction.
sprint_goal: Implement full script lifecycle management UI (edit, version history, diff) and add operational monitoring.
acceptance_criteria: A PUT request with valid content to an existing script ID returns 200 OK. A new version record is created in the database. The parent script's `activeVersionId` is updated. The operation is atomic.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests for transactional update passing.
testing_requirements: Integration tests verifying atomicity and data consistency.
business_value: Enables the maintenance and versioning of transformation scripts.

title: Frontend: Develop 'Edit Script' Page
description: Create the 'Edit Script' page that fetches the script data (including the content of the active version) via `GET /api/v1/transformations/{id}` and populates the form and editor.
sprint_goal: Implement full script lifecycle management UI (edit, version history, diff) and add operational monitoring.
acceptance_criteria: Navigating to the edit URL fetches and displays the correct script name and content. The form allows editing of the name and script content. The 'Save' button calls the `PUT` API endpoint. The UI handles unsaved changes with a confirmation dialog.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E tests passing.
testing_requirements: E2E tests for editing, saving, and cancelling with unsaved changes.
business_value: Provides the user interface for editing existing transformation scripts.

title: Backend: Implement APIs for Version History
description: Create new endpoints: `GET /api/v1/transformations/{id}/versions` to list all versions, and `GET /api/v1/versions/{versionId}` to get the content of a specific version.
sprint_goal: Implement full script lifecycle management UI (edit, version history, diff) and add operational monitoring.
acceptance_criteria: The list endpoint returns an array of version metadata (version number, timestamp, user). The content endpoint returns the full script content for a given version ID. Both endpoints are secured and require 'Administrator' role.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests passing.
testing_requirements: Integration tests.
business_value: Provides API support for viewing script history.

title: Frontend: Develop Version History Component
description: Create a React modal or view that lists all versions for a script, fetched from the API. Each row should display version metadata and have actions for 'Compare' and 'Revert'.
sprint_goal: Implement full script lifecycle management UI (edit, version history, diff) and add operational monitoring.
acceptance_criteria: The component correctly fetches and displays the list of versions. Checkboxes are available for selecting versions to compare. A 'Revert' button is available on each non-active version.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component unit tests passing.
testing_requirements: E2E tests.
business_value: Provides the user interface for viewing and interacting with script history.

title: Frontend: Integrate Diff Viewer Component
description: Integrate a library like `react-diff-viewer` or the Monaco Diff Editor. Create a component that takes two script content strings and displays a side-by-side diff.
sprint_goal: Implement full script lifecycle management UI (edit, version history, diff) and add operational monitoring.
acceptance_criteria: The component correctly highlights additions, deletions, and modifications. The diff view is presented in a modal or dedicated view. The component is performant with large script content.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E tests passing.
testing_requirements: E2E tests.
business_value: Allows administrators to visually inspect changes between script versions.

title: Backend: Integrate Prometheus-net Middleware
description: Add the `prometheus-net.AspNetCore` NuGet package to the WebApi project and configure the middleware in `Program.cs` to expose the `/metrics` endpoint.
sprint_goal: Implement full script lifecycle management UI (edit, version history, diff) and add operational monitoring.
acceptance_criteria: The application builds successfully with the new package. The `/metrics` endpoint is accessible when the application is running. The endpoint returns default .NET metrics.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Manual verification of /metrics endpoint.
testing_requirements: Manual test.
business_value: Provides the foundation for operational monitoring.
